column2: (sees Rachel) Oh, uh, hey Rach. I uh, I was just coming over here to\nuh\xc2\x85 Oh wait, I don\xc2\x92t have to lie to you, you don\xc2\x92t live here anymore. Uh,\nI\xc2\x92m eating their food. What are you doing?'
Ross is on a date with my sister and they shut the drapes two and\na-half-hours ago.'
Whoa, I didn\xc2\x92t know we could date your sister!'
Joey we know you steal our food.'
I\xc2\x92m good.'
(To Rachel) Oh, are the drapes still closed hon?'
Yeah. And y\xc2\x92know who should\xc2\x92ve shut their drapes? Is that\nperverted old couple two doors over.'
(looking) Is that a swing?'
Oh don\xc2\x92t even ask!'
Yuck!'
I can\xc2\x92t believe Ross went out with Rachel\xc2\x92s sister! When\nChandler made out with my sister I was mad at him for 10 years.'
That was like 5 years ago.'
Yeah you got 5 years left!'
Joey\xc2\x85'
You wanna make it 6?!'
Oh Ross, hi! Hey, how are ya? There you are!'
Hey!'
(to Gunther) I\xc2\x92ll take a coffee. (To Ross) So how was your big date\nlast night?'
Uhh, it was okay. Yeah, it was fun.'
Yeah fun? Great! So uh, so did you guys hit it off?'
I guess so.'
So uh, so did anything happen? Because rumor has it you guys shut\nthe drapes!'
No. No. Nothing happened. I shut the drapes to uh, show her slides of my\nfavorite fossils.'
Oh, slides. (Laughs.) So really nothing happened.'
Something could\xc2\x92ve happened. All right? She-she really dug my slides.\nAnd-and she was definitely giving me the vibe.'
Right. Was it the, "Please don\xc2\x92t show me another picture of a\ntrilobite vibe?"'
Anyway, if she, if she wasn\xc2\x92t in to me, why-why would she ask me out\nagain?'
She asked-asked you out again?'

Yeah-uh-huh. Tomorrow night, Valentine\xc2\x92s Day, the most romantic day\nof the year. Who knows what could happen? I might not be shutting my drapes to show her my\nslides, if you know what I mean.'

Okay-okay-okay-okay-okay-okay-okay! I got it! I got it! I got it! I
can\xc2\x92t! I can\xc2\x92t! I can\xc2\x92t! I cannot go with you and my sister thing. Okay? I
just can\xc2\x92t. It\xc2\x92s just too weird, all right? I imagine the two of you together
and I freak out. It freaks me out. I can\xc2\x92t do it! I can\xc2\x92t do it.'
(while Rachel is finishing her rant) Okay! Okay! Okay! It\xc2\x92s okay.\n(Rachel stops.) It\xc2\x92s okay. Hey, it\xc2\x92s too weird for you, I won\xc2\x92t see her\nagain.'
Thank you. I\xc2\x85yeah.'
I mean after tomorrow night.'
No-no-no! No-no-no! Please Ross, I can\xc2\x92t! I can\xc2\x92t do it!\n(Starts to freak out.) It\xc2\x92s just gonna freak me out!!!'
Okay! Okay! Ooh-hey-hey-hey! Okay! Okay! Okay! I\xc2\x92ll-I\xc2\x92ll tell\nher tonight I can\xc2\x92t see her anymore.'
Ross thanks.'
You want me to call her right now?'
Oh no! No! No-no-no-no! No, I mean come on that\xc2\x92s-that\xc2\x92s\ncrazy\xc2\x97I mean that\xc2\x92s crazy. So what\xc2\x92s-what\xc2\x92s going on with you? What is\ngoing on with you?'
Well umm, oh! I might be teaching another class this semester!'
Yeah do it now, call right now.'
(crying) This is my favorite part.'
(crying) Yeah me too.'
Oh y\xc2\x92know what\xc2\x92s sadder than this? Bambi. I cried for\nthree days with that movie. No wait two! Because on the third day my mother killed herself\nso I was partly crying for that.'
(totally not crying) Well see now that I can see crying over, but Bambi\nis a cartoon!'
(crying) You didn\xc2\x92t cry when Bambi\xc2\x92s mother died?'
Yes it was very sad when the guy stopped drawing the deer!'
Chandler there\xc2\x92s nothing wrong with crying! I mean you don\xc2\x92t\nhave to be so macho all the time.'
I\xc2\x92m not macho.'
Yeah you\xc2\x92re right. I don\xc2\x92t know what I was thinking.'
No, I guess I just never really cried. Y\xc2\x92know? I\xc2\x92m not a\ncrying kind of guy.'
Come on man there\xc2\x92s gotta be something that gets you choked up! Like\nuh, uh oh, what if you saw a three-legged puppy?'
I\xc2\x92d be sad sure, but I wouldn\xc2\x92t cry.'
Okay, what if the puppy said, "Help me Chandler. All the other\npuppies pick on me."'
Cry?! I just found a talking puppy, I\xc2\x92m rich!'
Oh, I\xc2\x92ve got it! I have got it! (Gets up and gets something from\nthe dresser underneath the TV.) Pictures from your childhood. This will get you going\ngood!'
All right, what\xc2\x92s going on there? (Points to a picture.)'
Oh, that\xc2\x92s Parent\xc2\x92s Day, first grade. That\xc2\x92s me with\nthe janitor Martin.'
Where were your parents?'
Oh they didn\xc2\x92t want to come!'
Oh Chandler!'
Poor thing!'
So that story doesn\xc2\x92t make you cry?'
No! Look, I don\xc2\x92t cry! It\xc2\x92s not a big deal! Okay?!'
No! It\xc2\x92s not okay! It\xc2\x92s not okay at all!! You\xc2\x92re dead\ninside!!'
Excuse me.'
Yeah?'
Are you Phoebe Buffay?'
Yeah.'
Can-can I get your autograph, I\xc2\x92m your biggest fan. (Holds out a\nnapkin and a pen.)'
Oh you\xc2\x92re my biggest fan? I\xc2\x92ve always wanted to meet you! Hi!\n(Shakes his hand.) Sure! Yeah! (Signs the autograph)'
Wow! Wow, thanks a lot! I just wanna say, I think you\xc2\x92re really\ntalented.'

You\xc2\x92re just saying that because you\xc2\x92re my biggest fan. (The\nfan leaves and Joey approaches.) (To Joey) Joey listen, take good care of that guy, okay?\n(Points) He\xc2\x92s a fan. (To the fan as she\xc2\x92s leaving) Bye! (Exits)'
(to the fan) So, you saw me on Days Of Our Lives huh? Want me to,\nwant me to do a little Dr. Drake Remoray for ya?'
I have no idea what you\xc2\x92re talking about. But I, but I just got\nPhoebe Buffay\xc2\x92s autograph!'
Oh, you\xc2\x92re Phoebe\xc2\x92s fan!'
Oh yeah! I\xc2\x92ve seen all her movies.'
Movies?'
That was Phoebe Buffay, the porn star.'
(laughs) I don\xc2\x92t think so.'
No-no, it was! She was in Sex Toy Story 2, Lawrence of Alabia, and I\ngot her autograph! The guys at the comic book store aren\xc2\x92t gonna believe this!\n(Exits.)'
Hey Gunther, don\xc2\x92t let that guy in here anymore! He just said\nPhoebe\xc2\x92s a porn star!'
Well, I wouldn\xc2\x92t call her a star, but she\xc2\x92s really good. You\nshould check out Inspecther Gadget.'
Hey!'
Hey!'
You\xc2\x92ll never believe what just happened, Ross just totally blew me\noff and he didn\xc2\x92t even tell me why!'

Ohhh well. Y\xc2\x92know what honey? The best thing to do to get over a\nguy is to start dating someone else. Oh! There is this great guy you will love at work\nnamed Bob! He\xc2\x92s a real up-and-comer in Human Resources.'
Y\xc2\x92know, thanks for trying to cheer me up, but I\xc2\x92m not gonna date\nsome random guy from your work.'
It\xc2\x92s not random, it\xc2\x92s Bob.'

It\xc2\x92s probably because not mature enough. Or smart enough. Maybe he
doesn\xc2\x92t like the way I dress\xc2\x97No that can\xc2\x92t be it. It\xc2\x92s really gotta be
the smart thing. Oh I\xc2\x92m so stupid! I\xc2\x92m just like this incredibly pretty
stupid girl!'
No honey, okay, okay, you wanna know why Ross canceled the date? Because\nI asked him to.'
You asked him too?!'
Hm-mmm.'
Why?!'
Because you are my sister and Ross and I have this huge history\xc2\x85'
I don\xc2\x92t understand, do you want to go out with Ross?'
No.'
You don\xc2\x92t want him, but you don\xc2\x92t want me to have him?'
(changing the subject) Y\xc2\x92know Bob in Human Resources\xc2\x85'
Ugh! I cannot believe you did this too me! You had me doubting how smart I\nwas! (Gasps) You had me doubting my fashion sense!'
Look, this is not that big of a deal! You just don\xc2\x92t date Ross!\nThere\xc2\x92s a million other guys out there, you just\xc2\x85'
Hey! You have no right to tell me what to do.'
I\xc2\x92m not telling you what to do! I am telling you what not to\ndo!'
Why are you so jealous of me?'
Jill this is not about me being jealous of you! This is about you being\na brat! Wanting what you can\xc2\x92t have!'
Can\xc2\x92t have?! Excuse me, the only thing I can\xc2\x92t have is dairy!\n(Starts to storm out.)'
All right, all right, well you just blew your chances at dating Bob!'
Who?!'
In Human Resources!!!!!!'
\xc2\x85I am jealous of her?! I mean who does she think she is?! Princess\nCaroline?!'
You\xc2\x92re jealous of Princess Caroline?'
Do I have my own castle?'
Hey! Uh, Phoebe\xc2\x92s not here is she?'
No.'
(noticing the bag Joey\xc2\x92s carrying) Oh great! Did you get a movie?'
Uhhh, yeah. Yeah. But uh, I don\xc2\x92t think it\xc2\x92s the kind\nyou\xc2\x92re gonna like.'
You didn\xc2\x92t get more movies that are gonna have us reaching for\nthe tissues all night did you?'
Sort of\xc2\x85'
Guys, what\xc2\x92s going on?'
(holds up the movie) Phoebe\xc2\x92s a porn star!'
What?!!'
Phoebe Buffay in Buffay
Oh my God!'
That\xc2\x92s Phoebe! Where did you get that?'
Well down at the adult video place down on Bleaker.'
And-and I, and I saw that Joey was about to go in, so I ran in ahead of\nhim to-to surprise him and, and then I pretended I didn\xc2\x92t know he was in there. (They\nall kinda look at him.)'
Wow! I mean, I just\xc2\x97I can\xc2\x92t, I can\xc2\x92t believe this.\nY\xc2\x92know, I mean you think you know someone even, even Phoebe who\xc2\x92s always been\nsomewhat of a question mark.'
This is so bizarre. I guess it kinda makes sense though, y\xc2\x92know she\nhad such a terrible childhood.'
Hey, I had a terrible childhood and I don\xc2\x92t do porn.'
Yes, but you are dead inside.'
All right well, I\xc2\x92d better take that back.'
Wh-what, why?'
We can\xc2\x92t watch that! I mean that\xc2\x92s Phoebe!'
Yeah you\xc2\x92re right, we can\xc2\x92t\xc2\x97we shouldn\xc2\x92t watch this.'
Absolutely not.'
(hands the tape back to Joey, but doesn\xc2\x92t let him grab it)\nY\xc2\x92know maybe a little bit!'
Probably just the first half.'
No! Hey no! This is wrong you guys! Phoebe\xc2\x92s our friend! Well,\nI\xc2\x92m not gonna watch it!'
Yeah! Good for you Joe!'
Yeah.'
Ah, I thought I\xc2\x92d find you here, Nasforatool.'
Buffay, are you going to plunge your stake into my dark places?'
Actually, I was kinda hoping it would be the other\nway around.'
Hold on a second! What is that on her ankle?'
Her ankle is what you\xc2\x92re watching?'
Well it\xc2\x92s hard to tell\xc2\x85 (Rachel gets up to get a closer look,\nonly she\xc2\x92s having some trouble.) Oh God, if she would just stop moving.'
She\xc2\x92s just doing her job!'
(sitting at the kitchen table with his back to the TV) You sick bastards!'
Oh, it\xc2\x92s a tattoo! That\xc2\x92s weird, Phoebe doesn\xc2\x92t\xc2\x85\nWait that\xc2\x92s Ursula! That\xc2\x92s not Phoebe that is Ursula!'
Re! Re! Then I can watch that! Rewind it! Rewind it!'
(entering) Hey! What\xc2\x92s up? (Sees the TV) Oh my God! What am I\ndoing?!!'
Hey sweetie!'
Hey! (He quickly tries to hide the book by throwing it under the\ncouch, only the couch has no back and it slides into the kitchen.)'
(picking up the book) Chicken Soup for the Soul? '
There\xc2\x92s no back to this couch!'
Why are you reading this? You hate this kind of stuff.'
Yeah I know, but I figured a shot y\xc2\x92know? Maybe one of those\nstories would make me cry and then you wouldn\xc2\x92t think I was y\xc2\x92know, all dead\ninside.'
Oh that\xc2\x92s so sweet! Look Chandler I don\xc2\x92t care if you\ncan\xc2\x92t cry, I love you.'
Oh that makes me feel so warm in my hollow tin chest.'
Stop it!'
No, I mean, come on, seriously think about it, we get married,\nwe\xc2\x92re up at the altar and I\xc2\x92m like this. (Makes a bored face.)'
I won\xc2\x92t care, because I know you will be feeling it all in here.\n(Points to her heart.)'
Yeah?'

Yeah! And if, and if we have a baby one-day, and the doctor hands it to
you in the delivery room and you don\xc2\x92t cry, so what! And-and-and, and if we take him
to college and come home and see his empty room for the first time, and you got nothing,
it won\xc2\x92t matter to me.'
Okay, well I won\xc2\x92t uh, worry about this anymore then.'

And-and-and if I die, from a long illness. And you\xc2\x92re writing out
my eulogy and you open a desk drawer and you find a note from me that says, "I will
always be with you," and you still can\xc2\x92t shed one tiny tear, I know you\xc2\x92ll
be crying a river inside.'
Aww, I love you so\xc2\x85'
What is wrong with you?!!!'
What?!'
What?! You can\xc2\x92t shed a tear for your dead wife!! Now, I left you a\nnote from the beyond!'
So you didn\xc2\x92t mean any of that?!'
No you robot!!'

You damn kids! You ring my bell one more time, I swear to\xc2\x85 (Opens the
door to find Jill standing there.) Ohh, uh Jill. Umm, that-that\xc2\x92s just a little game
I play with the kids down the hall. Umm, they\xc2\x92ve really taken a liking to me.
(Quickly looks out to see if they\xc2\x92re watching.) Uhh
what\xc2\x92s-what\xc2\x92s-what\xc2\x92s the matter?'

Rachel and I had a really big fight, can I come in? I-I mean I know
we\xc2\x92re not supposed to see each other anymore and I\xc2\x92m okay with that, it\xc2\x92s
just that I don\xc2\x92t know anybody in the city and I really need somebody to talk to
about it.'
Of course, what happened? (Lets her in.)'
(entering) I don\xc2\x92t want to talk about it.'
Okay, umm\xc2\x85'
But you know what might really cheer me up?'
What?'
Seeing some more of your super-cool slides.'
Wow! Really?!'
Totally, I love them! And, maybe you could finish telling me about all the\ndifferent kinds of sand.'
Well, I\xc2\x92d love to! Here, you wait right here and I\xc2\x92ll go get the\nprojector and my notes!'
Oh great! Thanks Ross, you\xc2\x92re such a good friend!'
Ohh!'
Hey! Have you guys seen Jill? I can\xc2\x92t find her anywhere.'
No, I haven\xc2\x92t.'
Well, is Ross home? Maybe I\xc2\x92ll just call him to see if he\xc2\x92s\nactually seen her. '
Who is it?'
It\xc2\x92s Phoebe! Phoebe!'
Hey!'
(seeing her dress) Oh God. So-so you\xc2\x92re making porn movies.'
No I\xc2\x92m not.'
We\xc2\x92re still rolling!'
You\xc2\x92re making one right now!'
Let\xc2\x92s go Phoebe!'
And-and you\xc2\x92re using my name!'
Yeah, can I help you with something?'
Phoebe, come on!'
Look, I\xc2\x92m talking right now! You\xc2\x92re\xc2\x97you mean her.'
Y\xc2\x92know, twin stuff is always a real big seller.'
What?!'
Yeah, I can talk them into giving you like, 30 dollars.'

No!! No way! No! And stop using my name! And shame on you! (Yells into\nthe apartment) And shame on all of you! You\xc2\x92re disgusting! Especially you (points to\nsomeone) with that! (Storms away.)'
Slides are almost ready.'
Yeah. Ooh, I know what this is missing! Alcohol!'
Uh okay, well there\xc2\x92s-there\xc2\x92s wine in the kitchen.'
Oh great! (Goes to get it as the phone rings.)'
(answering it) Hello?'
(on phone) What is my sister doing there?! And why are the\ndrapes shut?!'
O-okay, Rach calm-calm down, okay? She-she\xc2\x92s really upset we\xc2\x92re\njust talking.'
Ross! I think she is trying to make something happen with you to get\nback at me!'
So that\xc2\x92s the only reason she could be here huh? It couldn\xc2\x92t\nhave anything to do with the fact that-that maybe I\xc2\x92m a good listener and I uh I put\non a great slide show!'
Ross, I am telling you that she is using you to get back at me!'

Y\xc2\x92know what? I think I can take care of myself, I\xc2\x92ll talk to you\nlater. Good-bye. (Hangs up the phone and turns to find Jill sitting really close to him.)\nWhoa! Uh, that was your sister actually. She-she thinks that you\xc2\x92re just using me.'
So? (Kisses him passionately.)'
Hey!'
Hey!'
So, I just came from the company Ursula works for.'
Oh no, not you too!'
No! No! I just went to pick up Phoebe Buffay\xc2\x92s checks; there were a\nlot of them.'
Nice!'
Um-mmm, and I won\xc2\x92t have to go there anymore because I gave\nthem my correct address.'
That\xc2\x92s great, but isn\xc2\x92t it gonna bother that people still think\nyou\xc2\x92re a porn star?'
Oh no! No! I know how to handle it.'
You do?'

Yeah. (She notices some guy putting a coat on his girlfriend is trying
to remember where he\xc2\x92s seen her before.) (To him) You\xc2\x92re trying to figure out
where you know me from? All right, I\xc2\x92ll give you a hint. From porn! Okay? (He tries
to rush his girlfriend out.) Yeah your pervert boyfriend watched me in a porno movie! (To
Joey) See?'
Yeah.'
Hey.'
(To Rachel) You uh, you may have been right about Jill.'
Oh! I knew it! What happened?'
Umm, she kissed me.'
What?! You kissed!'
(To Monica) Maybe we should give them some privacy.'
(To Chandler) Shhhh!!!'
Look, I uh, I tried not to kiss her, okay?'
Well, it doesn\xc2\x92t sound like it! I mean, it\xc2\x92s pretty easy not\nto kiss someone, you just don\xc2\x92t kiss them! See look at us, right now, not kissing!'
Let me finish, okay? She started kissing me and-and I didn\xc2\x92t stop it.\nI guess I-I just wasn\xc2\x92t thinking\xc2\x85'
Yeah that\xc2\x92s right you weren\xc2\x92t thinking! Y\xc2\x92know what? Let\nme give you something to think about! (She pulls up her sleeves and steps towards him.)'
Oh wait\xc2\x97hold it! But then I started thinking and I stopped the\nkissing.'
Oh, well thank you for taking your tongue out of my sister\xc2\x92s mouth\nlong enough to tell me that.'
Look I-I realize if anything were to happen with me and Jill then nothing\ncould ever happen with us!'
What?!'

No, I mean, look I don\xc2\x92t know if anything is going to happen with us,\nagain. Ever. But I don\xc2\x92t want to know that it-it never could. So I stopped it and she\ngot mad and broke my projector.'
Wow. I, I don\xc2\x92t even know what to say. Thank you. (Gently kicks\nhim.)'
You\xc2\x92re welcome. (Gently kicks her back.)'
Oh my God! Are-are you crying?'
(crying hysterically) I just don\xc2\x92t see why those two can\xc2\x92t\nwork things out!'
All right, I\xc2\x92m leaving! Because I\xc2\x92m not going to spend one more\nday with someone whose out to sabotage my every move. That\xc2\x92s you Rachel!'
Yeah, I got that.'
(To Ross) And you! I throw myself at you and you say no, how gay are you?'
You take care Jill.'
(happily) Okay, see ya! (Exits.)'
Bye-bye-e!'
Bye.'
(starts crying) I-I can\xc2\x92t believe Jill\xc2\x92s gone. (They all\nlook at him.) I can\xc2\x92t help it, I opened a gate.'
